definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: The heart of the Aztecs' power was an economic unity.
sentences.chinese: 阿芝科特政权的核心是一个经济统一体。

sentences.english: On my path of light I learned that we are all one.
sentences.chinese: 在我通往光明的路上，我认识到，我们是一个统一体。

sentences.english: A unity invariably tends to break up into different parts.
sentences.chinese: 统一体总要分解为不同部分的。

sentences.english: The teaching in fact is the preinstall and the production harmonious entity.
sentences.chinese: 教学实际上就是预设和生成的和谐统一体。

sentences.english: Cyber-physical systems are integrations of computation, networking, and physical worlds.
sentences.chinese: 信息物理系统是计算，网络和物理世界的统一体。

sentences.english: An ideal is a multi-level entity.
sentences.chinese: 理想是多层次的统一体。

sentences.english: Neptune has two sides - inspiration, but also confusion.
sentences.chinese: 海王星是灵感与混乱的矛盾统一体。

sentences.english: The world is an entia filled with contradictory.
sentences.chinese: 世界本身就是一个矛盾统一体。
幸福存在于一个连续统一体。

sentences.english: Fairness and efficiency constitute an entia of contradictions.
sentences.chinese: 公平与效率是一个矛盾的统一体。

sentences.english: Together they form a "unity of knowledge and practice" of the continuum.
sentences.chinese: 它们共同形成”知行合一”的统一体。

sentences.english: Contradiction is one of the opposites of a single entity.
sentences.chinese: 矛盾是一个统一体的对立面之一。

definition: lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
monism, belief that the universe is made of a single substance
dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
mutually related karma (idiom); fates are intertwined/interdependent
to depend on sth for existence/dependent on
